Germany’s coaching staff have all sent messages of support to Loris Karius after his errors in the Champions League final, goalkeeping coach Andreas Koepke has confirmed.

The stopper is yet to be called up to the full national team but has represented his country at every youth level, and manager Joachim Low has been in touch with the player since Saturday evening.

“We have tried to help him pick himself him up and we wrote to him telling him to keep his head up,” Koepke revealed.

“[The criticism received afterwards was] very borderline and totally incomprehensible on the part of experts with whom I played myself [Lothar Matthaus called it the “worst goalkeeping display in the last 20 or 30 years”.]

“It’s a very brutal thing to experience. I hope he will be supported by Jurgen Klopp and by Liverpool so he can get through it.”

Low, coach Oliver Bierhoff and Koepke all texted Karius after the defeat in Kiev.
